etymologies: late Middle English; earliest use found in Guy de Chauliac's Grande Chirurgie. From post-classical Latin emplasticus (also implasticus) causing to adhere from Hellenistic Greek ἐμπλαστικός causing to adhere from ancient Greek ἐμπλαστός daubed on or over (from ἐμπλάσσειν to plaster up + -τός, suffix forming verbal adjectives) + -ικός

definitions: Having the property of being adhesive or glutinous; designating this property.
